description.narrative: ERI has the seven-month course, students acquire a greater understanding of the link between development and human rights and an insight into the approaches and objectives of stakeholders involved in the region#s development. Through rigorous classroom and field-based training, the school fosters the development of earth rights leaders, some of whom go on to establish and lead their own organizations. Upon graduation, the students join a growing network of alumni across the region with whom they may collaborate and share knowledge in pursuit of a common goal # that the region#s development is shaped by and benefits local people, as opposed to powerfulbusiness and government actors.

participating-org.narrative: ERI has long recognized an overwhelming regional need to provide grassroots activists and campaigners with the knowledge, capacity,and connections required for the defence of community and environmental rights and the pursuit of justice. EarthRights International#s (ERI) EarthRights School (ERS) plays an important role in fulfilling this need. The ERS curriculum equips civil society leaders from around the region # and primarily from communities confronting earth-rights abuses # with the toolkits, skillsets, and regionaland global networks to defend and promote earth rights through the strategic and coordinated deployment of efforts. Throughout the seven-month course, students acquire a greater understanding of the link between development and human rights and an insight into the approaches and objectives of stakeholders involved in the region#s development. Through rigorous classroom and field-based training, the school fosters the development of earth rights leaders, some of whom go on to establish and lead their own organizations. Upon graduation, the students join a growing network of alumni across the region with whom they may collaborate and share knowledge in pursuit of a common goal # that the region#s development is shaped by and benefits local people, as opposed to powerful business andgovernment actors.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to a sustainable livelihood
